intro: Disporum ovale, commonly known as the white woodland star, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are erect and slender. Disporum ovale plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various invertebrates.
